messages.subject: RE: [UnschoolingDiscussion] Response to offlist from Laura
messages.msgSnippet: I googled cursilissta and got back do you mean cursillista? which is something about a Christian community - so not the pagan anyway. Robyn L. Coburn
messages.messageBody:
I googled cursilissta and got back "do you mean cursillista?" which is
something about a Christian community - so not the pagan anyway.

Robyn L. Coburn


<<No I'm not a Cursilissta. Please tell me that is the name of someone from
some exotic island or a little known pagan religion. I love the way the
word moves around in my mouth when i pronounce it.>>






[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]

messages.subject: Response to offlist from Laura
messages.msgSnippet: Sorry to bring this to the list....but aol won t accept email from me. No I m not a Cursilissta.  Please tell me that is the name of someone from some exotic
messages.messageBody:
Sorry to bring this to the list....but aol won't accept email from me.

No I'm not a Cursilissta. Please tell me that is the name of someone from
some exotic island or a little known pagan religion. I love the way the
word moves around in my mouth when i pronounce it.

Julie S.---who will be really disappointed if it is just a surname
----- Original Message -----
From: "The Bucknum's" <ctbucknum@...>
To: <UnschoolingDiscussion@yahoogroups.com>
Sent: Friday, January 02, 2004 3:56 PM
Subject: [UnschoolingDiscussion] Good parenting mommy list


> HI I thought I might ask you all if you know of any good on line AP
support groups. Years ago I was on Alterna Moms Unite but their forum seems
to be gone. Mango Mamas gone too and I would like to find an online hangout
for myself somewhere to regroup so to speak. That link to the edgy-catin
mamas looked promising for about four or five minutes till I read about how
pinning your kid down to brush there teeth was recommended. Anyway thanks
for your time
> Teresa in Canada
>
